person.persName: Mortimer J. Lewis (Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of James Lewis and Sophronia Lewis. Married to America "Mary" J. Town Lewis in Green County, Kentucky, on February 24, 1859. Father of James William Lewis and Robert L. Lewis. Attended school in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned seven enslaved persons in Green County in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860. Served in the 33rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from September 13, 1862, to April 7, 1864. Tried for desertion, in October 1863, but found not guilty. Found guilty of being absent without leave and sentenced to a forfeiture of pay and to serve for an additional ten months in the U.S. Army. Served in the 26th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from April 7, 1864, to June 30, 1865.
